  • All Classes
 

All Classes

  • All Classes Interface Summary Class Summary Enum Summary 
    Class Description
    Booster
    Enum for the different Boosters
    BoosterElement
    Booster Hud Element which shows the active Booster Icons on the top of the screen.
    BoosterEvent
    Event for handling Booster Items so we can know which type of Booster was activated and if it is still active in the current render process.
    BoosterItemObject
    Booster Item GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    Camera
    Class for the Camera which enables us to move the whole background instead of only the character.
    CharacterObject
    Character GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    Collidable
    Interface for Collidable GameObjects which implements the collide Method for GameObjects, so we can detect the collision for each Object.
    DestroyablePlatformObject
    Destroyable Platform GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    Drawable
    Interface for Drawable GameObjects which implements the draw Method for GameObjects and enables us to draw on the Canvas.
    DynamicBitmap
    Class for creating Bitmaps and also for helping us with the resource management.
    EctsElement
    Represents the ECTS HUD element.
    ECTSEvent
    Event for handling ECTS changes so we know when the character collected an ECTS Coin
    EctsItemObject
    ECTS Item GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    Event
    Interface for Events
    EventAnimatedSprite
    Represents an event based animated sprite.
    EventListener
    Interface for handling Events which implements the onEvent Method
    EventSystem
    System for handling Events which enables us to subscribe to certain EventListeners from everywhere in our code so we can always know what happens in the Game.
    ExampleInstrumentedTest
    Instrumented test, which will execute on an Android device.
    ExampleUnitTest
    Example local unit test, which will execute on the development machine (host).
    GameActivity
    Activity for the Game itself where we listen to Pause and Resume Events to pause or resume the game and Lose or Win Events to get to the next level or show the Losing Splashscreen.
    GameLoop
    Class for the GameLoop.
    GameObject
    Main GameObject which enables us to distinguish different Objects in the Game.
    GameSurfaceView
    Class for the GameSurfaceView.
    HealthEvent
    Basic event for handling health updates so we know when the character has lost a life.
    HighscoreActivity
    Activity for the List of Highscores you reached in the Game.
    Hud
    Represents a head-up display (HUD) for the GameSurfaceView.
    HudElement
    Base class for HUD elements.
    ItemObject
    Item GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    LevelEvent
    Event for handling level initialization.
    LifeElement
    Represents a single life (heart) HUD element.
    LoseActivity
    Activity for the Splash Screen that comes when you lost the game with the View Animation and the achieved Highscore.
    LoseEvent
    Event for Handling Losing which gives us the insight from outside the game if we can make an intent to the LoseActivity.
    MenuActivity
    Activity for the Game's Menu where you can start the Game or see your Highscores.
    PauseEvent
    Event for Pausing the Game which is especially important for clearing the resources from outside of the Gameloop.
    PlatformObject
    Platform GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    ProfessorObject
    Professor GameObject which is there for creating, drawing, updating an detecting collision.
    ResumeEvent
    Event for Resuming the Game which is especially important for reloading the resources from outside of the Gameloop.
    Scene
    Class that implements the Scene which enables us to build our game in a single scene and even create different scenes for different levels.
    Score
    Class for the Score Database-Entity which generates the table for Highscores
    ScoreDao
    Interface for the Score Data Access Object which enables us to make certain database queries.
    ScoreRoomDatabase
    Abstract class for the entire Room Database for the Highscores.
    Sprite
    Represents a basic sprite that can be rendered on a Canvas.
    TimeAnimatedSprite
    Represents a time based animated sprite.
    TouchEvent
    Event for handling Touchscreen Usage which enables us to know wherever when the screen is touched and in what direction
    Updatable
    Interface for Updatable GameObjects which implements the update Method and enables us to update our GameObjects with a deltaTime.
    VelocityEvent
    Event for tracking the velocity of touch events which fives us more information about how fast the movement of the touch event was.
    VideoActivity
    Activity for the Video you see when the Game starts which has also a Skip Function which leads you to the Game's Menu
    WinActivity
    Activity for the Splash Screen that comes when you won the game with the View Animation and the achieved Highscore.
    WinEvent
    Event for Handling Winning which gives us the insight from outside the game if we can make an intent to the WinActivity.
